admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
trustfund:
TF020090-BELGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF036985-EGYPT - SCHISTOSOMIASIS PROJECT,TF034964-EGYPT - SCHISTOSOMIASIS CONTROL,TF032006-EGYPT - NATIONAL
            SCHISTOSOMIASIS CONTROL,TF021389-HEALTH MANAGEMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the National
            Schistosomiasis Control Project for Egypt was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was modest, and the Bank and borrower performance
            were both satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that
            the Schistosomiasis project has been characterized by its
            compliance to implement the recommended international sound
            and widely recognized control strategies. In addition, Egypt
            has adapted the control strategies to the country situation
            taking into consideration the epidemiological and
            demographic pattern, these were used to select and target
            priority intervention areas. Awareness campaigns created an
            adequate understanding of the consequences of the disease
            among the public. The need to expand the coverage of the
            National Schistosomiasis Control Program to Nile Delta has
            long been recognized in Egypt. This project lacked a
            detailed and clear implementation plan which led to a
            misunderstanding of the specific activities that were to be
            implemented and financed. The client would have been better
            guided and assisted if a well-planned project was launched,
            more supervision provided, and monitoring of higher budgets.
            Capacity building activities would have ensured an earlier
            start of the project and would have avoided delays in
            implementation. A list of indicators was developed at the
            project preparation stage without a baseline or clear
            arrangements for data collection, analysis and reporting
            that led to unsatisfactor
